intro: Tabernaemontana vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems, and it produces a milky sap that is toxic. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
